Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and very faint traces of at least one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394458) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394458)
